cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 194 (Friday, December 27, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DeSAULNIER:H.R. 10560.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8.The single subject of this legislation is:expanding access to exercise equipment, facilities, andinstruction for people with disabilities.[Page H7427]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

bill.title: Exercise and Fitness for All Act

item.title: Exercise and Fitness for All Act
Exercise and Fitness for All Act
To promote the provision of exercise machines and equipment, and exercise and fitness classes and instruction, that are accessible to individuals with disabilities.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
